icontrol.drivers.instruments.srs

Class SRS_SR850

  • java.lang.Object
    • icontrol.drivers.Device
      • icontrol.drivers.instruments.srs.SRS_SR850

  • @iC_Annotation(CommPorts=GPIB,
               InstrumentClassName="SRS SR850")
public class SRS_SR850
extends Device
    This class implements functionality to communicate with a Stanford Research Systems SR850 Lock-in.

    Instrument Commands:

    • getTimeConstant() (not shown in the GUI)
    • getSensitivity() (not shown in the GUI)
    • setAmplitude(double)
    • setFrequency(double)
    • setPhase(double)
    • setReferenceSource(int)
    • setSensitivity(int)
    • setTimeConstant(int)
    • GainCalibration(float, double, double, double, boolean, int, String)
    • #SweepF(double, double, double, boolean, int, String)
    • Note that more commands might be defined as generic GPIB commands

    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    egbittle (Emily Bittle: egbittle@gmail.com), KPP (Kurt Pernstich: pernstich@alumni.ethz.ch)

      • Open

        public void Open()
          throws java.io.IOException,
                 javax.script.ScriptException
        Extra initialization of the SR850 after establishing the IO Connection via GPIB. It invokes the base class' Open, and ...

        The description of the parameters and exceptions was copied from the implementation in the super class. See Device.OpenGPIB(int) for details.

        Overrides:
        Open in class Device
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when an sending / receiving data caused a GPIB error
        javax.script.ScriptException - when the response to a *IDN? query does not match the expected result; bubbles up from checkIDN.

      • setReferenceSource

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="<html>Sets the frequency reference source.</html>",
                   ParameterNames="Frequency reference: { [0, 2] }",
                   DefaultValues="0",
                   ToolTips="<html>0 ... internal<br>1 ... internal sweep<br>2 ... external</html>")
 @iC_Annotation(MethodChecksSyntax=true)
public void setReferenceSource(int Fmodvalue)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            throws java.io.IOException,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   java.util.zip.DataFormatException
        Sets the frequency reference source.

        This method performs a Syntax-Check.

        Parameters:
        Fmodvalue - The FMOD command sets or queries the reference source. The parameter i selects internal (i=0), internal sweep (i=1) or external (i=2).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - re-thrown from SendToInstrument
        java.util.zip.DataFormatException - when the Syntax Check failed.

      • Measure

        private SRS_SR850.MValue Measure()
                          throws java.io.IOException,
                                 javax.script.ScriptException
        Reads a measurement from the Instrument. The method returns with the measured R, Phi, and Frequency values or with NaN if the measurement was invalid.
        Returns:
        Returns an MValue object with the measured values or with NaN if the measurement was invalid. During JUnit Testing, random numbers are returned.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - re-thrown from SendToInstrument
        javax.script.ScriptException - re-thrown from Utilities.getFloat

      • SweepF

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="<html>Measures the lock-in signal as a function of the internal reference frequency.<br>Sets the Lock-in\'s Reference Signal to Internal.</html>",
                   ParameterNames={"Start Frequency [Hz] { [.001, 102e3] }","Stop Frequency [Hz] { [.001, 102e3] }","Frequency Increment","logarithmic Freq. spacing?","Delay time multiplier","File Extension","Calibration File"},
                   DefaultValues={"2000","3000","100","false","250",".fsweep.txt",""},
                   ToolTips={"","","<html>Frequency difference or number of steps per decade<br>if logarithmic sweep is selected</html>","","<html>Specifies the multiplier of the current Time Constant set in the LIA to wait after setting<br>the new frequency and starting the measruement.<br>A minimum of 1 sec is always included.</html>","","The Filename containing the gain/phase calibration as taken<br>with the script command GainCalibration"})
 @iC_Annotation(MethodChecksSyntax=true)
public java.util.ArrayList<SRS_SR850.MValue> SweepF(double FreqStart,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    double FreqStop,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    double FreqInc,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    boolean FreqLog,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    int DelayFactor,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    java.lang.String FileExtension,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    java.lang.String CalibrationFile)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             throws javax.script.ScriptException,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    java.io.IOException,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    java.util.zip.DataFormatException
        Sweeps the frequency and takes a measurement at every frequency. The data is shown in a chart and is also saved in a text file. The chart is shown only if a File Extension was specified, because if no extension was specified, SweepF is most likey called by GainCalibration.
        Parameters:
        FreqStart - Start Frequency
        FreqStop - Stop Frequency
        FreqInc - Increment in Frequency respectively number of points per decade. See Utilities.GenerateValues
        FreqLog - When false the frequency points are equally spaced; if true they are logarithmically spaced. See GenerateValues
        DelayFactor - After setting the new frequency, a time delay is added before taking the measurement. This time delay is a multiple of the LIA's time constant. DelayFactor specifies this multiplier. Must be greater than 0.
        FileExtension - This String is appended to the File Name. If the filename already exists, a new file with a counter is inserted between the FileName and the FileExtension. If FileExtension is empty, no data will be saved.
        CalibrationFile - The file name for the gain/phase calibration; the file can be generated with GainCalibration
        Returns:
        Returns the measured data points to be used in the follwing script command
        Throws:
        javax.script.ScriptException - When communication with the instrument failed, or the Frequency values could not be generated, or a File IO error ocurred.
        java.io.IOException - When communication with the Instrument failed (bubbled up from setReferenceSource, setFrequency, or setReferenceSource, or some more direct query commands.
        java.util.zip.DataFormatException - when the Syntax Check failed.

      • GainCalibration

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="<html>Performes a gain/phase calibration.<br>Uses \'SweepF\' to measure the real gain/phase at different frequencies.<br>Sets the Lock-in\'s Reference Signal to Internal.</html>",
                   ParameterNames={"Nominal Resistance","Start Frequency [Hz] { [.001, 102e3] }","Stop Frequency [Hz] { [.001, 102e3] }","Frequency Increment","logarithmic Freq. spacing?","Delay time factor","File Extension"},
                   DefaultValues={"50","2000","3000","100","false","250",".gcal.txt"},
                   ToolTips={"Specifies the resistance value of the DUT when making the gain/phase calibration.","","","<html>Frequency difference or number of steps per decade<br>if logarithmic sweep is selected</html>","","<html>Specifies the multiplier of the current Time Constant set in the LIA to wait after setting<br>the new frequency and starting the measruement.</html>",""})
 @iC_Annotation(MethodChecksSyntax=true)
public void GainCalibration(float NominalResistance,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            double FreqStart,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            double FreqStop,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            double FreqInc,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            boolean FreqLog,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            int DelayFactor,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            java.lang.String FileExtension)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     throws javax.script.ScriptException,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            java.io.IOException,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            java.util.zip.DataFormatException
        Performes the gain/phase calibration. It sweeps the frequency and takes a measurement at every frequency. A gain/phase calibration factor is calculated based on the specified nominal resistanance value and exported in a file. This file can be used in SweepF. The data is shown in a chart together with an interolation curve for inspection. The same interpolation curve will be used in SweepF (although it will be re-calculated there with the same settings).
        Parameters:
        NominalResistance - The value of the calibration resistor used to perform the gain/phase calibration.
        FreqStart - Start Frequency
        FreqStop - Stop Frequency
        FreqInc - Increment in Frequency respectively number of points per decade. See Utilities.GenerateValues
        FreqLog - When false the frequency points are equally spaced; if true they are logarithmically spaced. See GenerateValues
        DelayFactor - After setting the new frequency, a time delay is added before taking the measurement. This time delay is a multiple of the LIA's time constant. DelayFactor specifies this multiplier. Must be greater than 0.
        FileExtension - This String is appended to the File Name. If the filename already exists, a new file with a counter is inserted between the FileName and the FileExtension.
        Throws:
        javax.script.ScriptException - When generating or calculating the gain / phase interpolation curve failed, or when a File IO error ocurred
        java.io.IOException - When communication with the Instrument failed (bubbled up from getTimeConstant or some more direct query commands.
        java.util.zip.DataFormatException - when the Syntax Check failed.

        public double getSensitivity()
                      throws java.io.IOException,
                             javax.script.ScriptException
